intro: Dicalix acuminatus, commonly known as the sharp-pointed dicalix, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical or subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
